trans-unit.source: He is meditating in Halkhoriya Jungle, Bara District in Nepal.
trans-unit.target: Si trova nella giungla di Halkhoriya, in Nepal, e medita e detta i Suoi insegnamenti a Khenpo.

trans-unit.source: He is not eating anything.
Dharma Sangha wants to liberate the whole world by spreading Dharma and insight he’ve gained through his meditation.
trans-unit.target: Dharma Sangha intende liberare il mondo intero diffondendo il Dharma (Rettitudine) e gli insegnamenti che ha ottenuto nel corso delle Sue meditazioni.

trans-unit.source: Yes, he is already enlightened. The first stages of enlightenment occurred in his room at home.
Dharma Sangha can’t tell it now. Time will reveal.
trans-unit.target: Dharma Sangha al momento non è in grado di dirlo. Sarà il tempo a farlo.

trans-unit.source: It is actually called Bodhi Shravan Dharma Sangha, but it includes all religions, no one is excluded. Dharma Sangha will be moving forward by including all existing religions of the world.
trans-unit.target: Di fatto è chiamato Bodhi Shravan Dharma Sangha, ma include tutte le religioni, nessuna esclusa. Dharma Sangha si spingerà oltre includendo tutte le religioni esistenti nel mondo.

trans-unit.source: Bodhi: enlightenment, awakened.
Shravan: attending to, heeding, listening.
Dharma: wisdom.
Sangha: association, assembly, community.
Thus "Bodhi Shravan Dharma Sangha" is the wisdom as heeded from enlightened ones.

Impractical gifts are not really good to bring (pictures, vases etc). Dharma Sangha does not accept gifts. Below is a list of small practical things, which are needed regularly in the jungle:
Scissors.

Kitchenware (bigger pots, which bear direct fire, cutting knives, any non-electric kitchen tools, as there is not much electricity on the site, bigger plastic buckets and storing boxes to keep food safe from monkey-robbers, etc.)
Pens and copybooks.
CANDLES (not perfumed ones).
Sleeping bag or blankets.
Flashlights (solar powered, if possible).
Sealed medicine with English leaflets (especially for colds, cough, wound disinfectants, bandages and first aid supplies).
Lighters.
100% natural material clothes or mats for sitting on the ground.

If anyone has a notebook or laptop, which he or she does not need, and which has a long-lasting battery, it would be also appreciated by the young monks, who are helping Khenpo to write and translate the texts of Dharma Sangha prayers and teachings, etc.
Soap, shampoo, laundry soap.
Mosquito nets and natural sprays.

The most convenience place for foreigner is to land in Kathmandu. From Kathmandu it is about 6 hours drive to Parsa Bridge if you can take a bus or a private vehicle. From Parsa Bridge to Halkhoriya Jungle (about 6-7 km) you can take a tractor, which belongs to Bodhi Shrawan Dharma Sangha, or a 4-wheel vehicle to reach there. The road is a dry river bed and it is rough and bumpy ride.
trans-unit.target: Per gli stranieri, la via più semplice è quella di atterrare a Kathnmandu; dalla capitale ci vogliono circa 6 ore di guida per arrivare a Parsa Bridge (con l’autobus o un veicolo privato). Da Parsa Bridge alla giungla di Halkhoriya (6-7 km circa), si può prendere un trattore, di Bodhi Shrawan Dharma Sangha, o un veicolo 4x4. La strada è il letto di un fiume in secca ed è accidentata e sassosa.
